p: in which the P ( d ) term is the fraction of the target population willing to travel at least d miles. As the required travel distance increases, the fraction of the population willing to travel distance d decreases. We used a piecewise model that allows for different coefficients below and above a distance threshold of 5 miles to enable urban and rural populations to exhibit different willingness-to-travel patterns ( http://www.bio.utexas.edu/research/meyers/_docs/publications/SinghEID14Supplement.pdf ).
